title: DevContainer > mcp.json > Restart MCP Server not honoring configuration changes

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: chat-mcp-management
labels.description: Issues related to browsing and managing MCP Servers in VS Code

body: - VSCode Version: 1.102.3 - Local OS Version: Windows 11 Pro 10.0.26100 - Remote OS Version: DevContainer Based on node:22-bullseye - Remote Extension/Connection Type: Dev Containers - Logs: 2025-07-31 20:58:00.080 [info] Starting server from Remote extension host 2025-07-31 20:58:00.100 [info] Connection state: Starting 2025-07-31 20:58:00.101 [info] Connection state: Running 2025-07-31 20:58:01.440 [warning] [server stderr] error: unknown option '--cdp-endpoint http://10.11.20.206:9223' 2025-07-31 20:58:01.484 [info] Connection state: Error Process exited with code 1 2025-07-31 20:58:01.484 [error] Server exited before responding to `initialize` request. Steps to Reproduce: This is the reproducible steps on my workstation 1. Open a devContainer with .vscode/mcp.json 2. Assuming you have something like this: { "servers": { "playwright-npx": { "command": "npx", "args": [ "@playwright/mcp@latest", "--cdp-endpoint http://10.11.20.255:9223" ], "type": "stdio" } } You should also see some option to Start/Restart in light grey the specific MCP server (see screenshot). 3. If you change any settings, in my case the IP address was changed from .206 to .255, Save file, and hit restart option for the MCP server, the logs show it's still using the old IP 206 (ignore the fact I know this JSON setting is incorrect). 4. The only way to see this new setting apply is to Reload VS Code. Does this issue occur when you try this locally?: Yes Does this issue occur when you try this locally and all extensions are disabled?: Yes I don't use Codespace

title: Chat participant descriptions should render in listbox and not require hover

labels.name: ux
labels.description: User experience issues

body: No information is available when doing @ in agent mode to reference a chat participant, making it difficult for users to understand what the chat participant is doing. This information is available on hover but developer did not organically discover this.

title: Alias @ to # in Chat input to reference context

labels.name: ux
labels.description: User experience issues

body:
Users returning to VS Code from using other products like Cursor have muscle memory trained to use @ to reference context.

Should we alias @ to # so we don't break muscle memory for returning developers from other products?

title: deleteWordRight handles 1 whitespace differently from 2 whitespace

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: editor-input
labels.description: Editor text input

body:
Type: Bug Put this code in a .js file ``` foo.bar() //one space at beginning foo.bar() //two spaces at beginning ``` Put the cursor at the beginning of line 1 and press deleteWordRight. Foo is deleted, too. Well, it's not what I wanted, but ok whatever. That's not the bug here. Next, put the cursor at the beginning of line 2 and press deleteWordRight. Now, Foo is not deleted. The bug: I don't see why one whitespace is any different from two. I don't understand the logic for deleteWordRight so I can't suggest which is correct, but it should work the same in both cases. I know about #832 which is a sufficient workaround for me. 1. Open a chat editor linked to a [chat session](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/258320)
2. Reload 
3. When the editor reloads, the content will appear but the input box will not be linked to the session (broken state)

By "Broken state", the following is true:

- Submitting messages will not automatically forward to the correct chat participant (`@copilot)
- You will see the model picker/mode picker/other UX that should be hidden

title: Auto-update to host architecture when running under emulation

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

labels.name: install-update
labels.description: VS Code installation and upgrade system issues

body:
Refs https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/257068#issuecomment-3140127532

It is possible for users to end up porting their intel application to apple silicon and our update mechanism relies on `process.arch` to build the update feed url https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/6724a5fb368d582f7926d1e279e6690d9183e327/src/vs/platform/update/electron-main/updateService.darwin.ts#L78-L79

We can improve this flow a bit by detecting an emulation `app.runningUnderARM64Translation` and auto-update to the host architecture.

title: [NuGet MCP] Add proposal API for mapping MCP server.json to mcp.json

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

It appears there is no way for extensions to invoke this routing via the VS Code plugin API:
https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/3eaa65007ec41a0426295bea00914814bd5c0650/src/vs/platform/mcp/common/mcpManagementService.ts#L235

I am working on the Copilot Chat extension and have NuGet packages which contain an embedded `.mcp/server.json` file. I would like to map this to VS Code MCP JSON using the `toScannedMcpServerAndInputs` method.

That way, it can be flowed through the assisted installation flow.

I propose a new `enabledApiProposals` is added that exposes this mapping behavior.

Alternatively, the contract of `github.copilot.chat.mcp.setup.flow` could be changed to allow `server.json` format to be returned while still supporting VS Code's JSON format also -- perhaps with an enum to differentiate, thus allowing VS Code internally to do the mapping.

Related to https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/257679

title: GPT-4.1 has trouble with slow terminals
body:
Testing #258989

1. Set up Windows pwsh 7 profile to have a two-second start up time. See #258989 for details.
2. Close all terminals.
3. Ask the agent to run echo hi in a terminal.
4. :bug: The agent doesn't do anything because no terminals are open.
5. Open a terminal.
6. Ask the agent to run echo hi in a terminal.
7. :bug: The agent runs the command in a new terminal (expected) and reports that there is no output (not expected).

Edit: step 7 occurs because I disabled shell integration while testing the other issue. Enabling shell integration fixes step 7. Step 4 still seems like a bug to me.

title: Important fix for resource validation in MCP
body:
In this example:

MCP url: https://foo.com/mcp
WWW-Auth resource_metadata: https://foo.com/laugh/in/the/face/of/conventions.json
PRM: https://foo.com/laugh/in/the/face/of/conventions.json
PRM resource property: https://foo.com/mcp

I use to do:
a URL derived from "WWW-Auth resource_metadata" (which is actually just PRM) is compared to "PRM resource property"

but instead it should be:

"MCP url" compared to "PRM resource property"

Which is what this PR addresses

ref https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc9728#section-3.3

title: Contradictory messages leading to confusion and doing the wrong thing when creating a new project
body: Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No - VS Code Version: Latest Insiders - OS Version: Windows 11 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open a non-empty workspace folder 2. Runt he prmpt `#new can you create a fast-api application that shows n-queens in a grid and takes n as input. has a solve button and it uses genetic algorithms to solve it. and it should animate the solution.` 2.You will be prompted to select an empty folder, From folder picker create an empty folder in the current workspace folder and click `Select and Empty Workspace Folder` button on the dialog to open that 3. Next presented with the following modal dialog button I'm confused & i click `cancel ` as i didn't want to lose my changes. But nothing happend Tried this again, and this time clicked `ok`, and it worked as expected. Basically I had to ignore the modal dialog message, which was confusing and I had to try this twice to get it to do what i wanted. Suggestion: I think we should disable this modal dialog from showing up.

title: tweak create and run task description
Allow the canonical package name and version to be sent back from the install flow
body:
Related to https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot-chat/pull/420.

If available, the package `name` and `version` will be used to improve the UI asking the user to consent installation. For example, if the user typed `nuget.mcp.server` for installing a NuGet MCP server, it will show `Install NuGet.Mcp.Server@0.1.2-preview from microsoft, NuGet?`.

title: Listener to identify Human VS AI changes

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
Hi, I would like the ability to track how much code was generated by an Human VS how much code was generated by AI (Copilot, Cline etc).

My current idea is to create a new extension and listen to vscode.workspace.onDidChangeTextDocument and just track the changes there. But the event today does not report if another extension is generating that code or if it's a human. If we could just have a property flagging if the event was trigged by another extension that probably would be enough. 

So my ask here is, would be possible to add some way for developers of extensions to identify if the code being added in the editor is being made by an AI extension or by an human?

The next challenge will be how to expose and consume it, but we can do it more easily just saving to a temp file and reading/cleaning it after commits.

title: "System" Theme

labels.name: stale
labels.description: Issues that have not been triaged in an appropriate amount of time

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

I did not find a similar request, which honestly is surprising. Even more surprising is that there is no "System" theme that stays in sync with the system.

I would like to be able to choose both preferred Dark and Lights theme that stay in sync with my system theme on Linux. Most of the time I like a Dark theme, but there are times when ambient light is too bright to make this possible, such as working on a laptop outside on a sunny day or while driving (as a passenger of course).

body: Version: 1.103.0-insider (user setup) Commit: 724eea79bcad9a344a22eaecf949bca2f5f8f8bc Date: 2025-07-31T05:03:35.073Z Electron: 37.2.3 ElectronBuildId: 12035395 Chromium: 138.0.7204.100 Node.js: 22.17.0 V8: 13.8.500258-electron.0 OS: Windows_NT arm64 10.0.26100 - Open Chat Sessions view - Select a coding agent session - Send a message in chat editor to follow-up with coding agent - ✅ `@copilot` is automatically prepended to my chat message, and a comment is appropriately added to the PR - [Here was the comment and PR](https://github.com/microsoft/edit-projects/pull/54#issuecomment-3140817281). - ❔ Chat editor: I hoped I'd get the content streamed back in my editor, rather than static info - - ❔ Chat sessions view: I expected the status to switch from a check to the in-progress indicator - - ❔ I was also never shown a notification in the GHPR view that this session was in-progress or that it's ready for review (cc @alexr00)

title: Fix task completion messages to include task name and exit code
body:
Task completion messages in the chat agent tools were showing generic information without specifying which task ran or the actual exit code when tasks failed. This made it difficult for users to track task history and debug failures.

**Before:**
- ❌ `Task finished` (doesn't show which task)
- ❌ `Task failed with exit code.` (missing actual exit code number)
- ❌ `Task started and will continue to run in the background.` (generic)

**After:**
- ✅ `Task 'dev' finished` (shows specific task name)
- ✅ `Task 'build' failed with exit code 1.` (includes actual exit code)
- ✅ `Task 'watch' started and will continue to run in the background.` (shows task name)

The fix updates the completion message generation in both `runTaskTool.ts` and `createAndRunTaskTool.ts` to include the task name in all cases and the specific exit code number when tasks fail. This provides users with the debugging information and task history they need.

Fixes #258629.
